contentrichtext.text: In [[Norse mythology]], '''Viðfinnr''' ("wood-[[Finns|Finn]]"<ref name=LINDOW315>Lindow (2001:315).</ref>) is the father of [[Hjúki and Bil]], a brother and sister who, according to ''[[Gylfaginning]]'', were taken up from the [[earth]] by [[Máni]], the personified moon, as they were fetching water from the well [[Byrgir]]. ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== * [[John Lindow|Lindow, John]] (2001). ''[http://books.google.com/books?id=KlT7tv3eMSwC&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_navlinks_s#v=onepage&q=&f=false Norse Mythology: A Guide to the Gods, Heroes, Rituals, and Beliefs]''. [[Oxford University Press]]. ISBN 0-19-515382-0. {{Norse cosmology}} {{Norse mythology}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vidfinnr}} [[Category:People in Norse mythology and legends]] {{Norse-myth-stub}}
